title: How I Finally Memorized Modifier Ordering in Compose
description: For the longest time, I proudly had no idea of how Modifier ordering works, and would just guess and then guess again when something didn't look quite right. Here's how I finally ended up remembering how the ordering works.

title: Building a macOS screen saver in Kotlin
description: This article documents how I created my own custom screen saver for macOS, built almost entirely in Kotlin, using the powers of Kotlin Multiplatform compiled to macOS. Join me for a tale of Kotlin success and macOS failures.

title: Episode 210: Studio Jewelry
description: In this episode Chet, Romain and Tor chat with Sebastiano about how the Android Studio team builds UIs. We talk about how Compose for Desktop is used in parts of Android Studio and how the Compose Markdown renderer available in the Jewel library makes Studio Bot tick. ¬† Chapters: Intro (00:00) Android Dev UX team (00:39) What kind of libraries and languages are used to build Android studio? (1:52) Swing (2:53) Reactive and declarative programming models (8:25) SKIA for Kotlin (10:01) Jetpack Compose widgets (11:54) Jewel (13:07) Text rendering across platforms (15:51) Differences in behaviors (17:40) Support for markdown files (20:26) What is markdown? (21:25) Swing and html (25:45) Selection handling in StudioBot (28:46) Boosting productivity with Compose (30:40) Standalone vs plugin artifacts (34:29) The difference between Jewel & Swing (35:30) HTML vs Markdown (39:31) Markdeep (41:53) Jewel's Markdown API (43:46) Where to find Jewel? (46:54) Sebastiano‚Äôs podcast - Code with the Italians (47:34) Final thoughts (49:13) ¬† Links: Jetpack Compose Compose Multiplatform, for Desktop¬† Jewel Jewel Markdown Renderer ¬† Sebastiano: ‚Äã‚Äãhttps://github.com/rock3r, https://codewiththeitalians.it/ Romain: @romainguy,¬†threads.net/@romainguy, romainguy@androiddev.social Tor: threads.net/@tor.norbye and tornorbye@androiddev.social Chet: @chethaase,¬†threads.net/@chet.haase, and chethaase@androiddev.social ¬† Catch videos on YouTube ‚Üí https://goo.gle/adb-podcast¬†¬† Subscribe to Android Developers¬† ‚Üí https://goo.gle/AndroidDevs
author: Android Developers

title: Episode 209: Compose animations
description: In this episode Chet, Romain and Tor chat with Doris Liu from the Compose team about animations in Compose -- covering everything from the basic primitives up to the recently added Shared Element Transitions. ¬† Chapters: Intro (00:00) Animation capabilities of Compose (1:06) Different types of animation specs (3:43) Layers of functionality, transitions (7:49) TargetBasedAnimation (9:48) Vectors & velocity of color change (12:43) Second layer parallel to animation spec (16:39) Animation interruptions (18:48) Motion layout problem-solving (20:19) Both scale and move in question (25:45) Different mental models for layout animation in Compose vs. View (26:20) Shared element (31:05) Are there things you wish more people were aware of? (34:19) What's the tooling story for this? (41:57) What is Look Ahead? (43:16) All software is regret (48:49) New API: Modifier.animateBounds (51:52) How to reach Doris ‚Äì leave a comment (55:57) Motion Frame of Reference Placement (57:29) Wrap up (59:10) Links: Shared element tutorial ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3XrGYp5¬† Shared element talk ‚Üí https://goo.gle/47tm3qm¬† A quick guide to compose animations ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3Tm853p¬† The API layers except the highest level APIs we chatted about in the podcast ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3MGsiNE Doris: @doris4lt Romain: @romainguy,¬†threads.net/@romainguy, romainguy@androiddev.social Tor: threads.net/@tor.norbye and tornorbye@androiddev.social Chet: @chethaase,¬†threads.net/@chet.haase, and chethaase@androiddev.social¬†¬† Catch more Android Developers Backstage on YouTube ‚Üí https://goo.gle/adb-podcast ¬†¬† Subscribe to Android Developers YouTube ‚Üí https://goo.gle/AndroidDevs

title: 251- There's a new king in DI town
description: In this episode, Kaushik explores the evolution of dependency injection (DI) in Android development. title: Android Weekly Issue #650
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Why your mobile releases are a black box ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the status of the release?‚Äù Who knows. Uncover the unseen challenges that keep mobile development shrouded in mystery and drain your team‚Äôs efficiency. Discover how to break open the black box, enhance communication, and finally bring clarity to your release cycle. Type-Safe Navigation in Jetpack Compose: Passing Custom Classes Anil Kumar Beesetti looks at the long-awaited type safety added to Jetpack Navigation library, making navigation between destinations more robust, intuitive, and of-course safe. Test smarter, not harder: new testing strategies documentation Jose Alc√©rreca announces a significant update to our official documentation on testing strategies for Android developers. Sponsored Genius Scan SDK: a document scanner in your app Embed a reliable document scanner with OCR in your app, enabling your customers to capture high-quality, legible documents that you can process effortlessly. Hundreds of companies and millions of users trust the Genius Scan technology. Supports Android, iOS, and cross-platform frameworks. Widgets With Glance: Beyond String States Katie Barnett demonstrates using a CustomGlanceStateDefinition for managing complex GlanceWidget state. Demystifying Maestro‚Äôs UI Testing Implementation Sam Edwards shares some discoveries about the inner workings of Maestro with TONS of links to their open source implementation. Achieving Type-safe Navigation Results in AndroidX Compose for KMP FunkyMuse explores how to implement callback results between screens while maintaining complete type safety. Random Musings on the Android 16 Developer Preview 1 Mark Murphy rummages through the API differences report for Android 16 DP 1 Google Maps in Jetpack Compose: Polylines Joe Birch dives into the Polyline composable and shows how we can draw coordinate-based lines on our map. How to create a scrollable chart in Compose Multiplatform Alex Zhukovich creates a "Vertical Bar Chart" which will work on all platforms. Centering in Compose Zach Klippenstein explains the theory behind ‚Äúcentering‚Äù in Compose without assuming you know anything about the specifics of Compose's layout system. Gradle 8.11: Faster Configuration Cache and Improved Configuration Time I√±aki Villar examines Gradle 8.11, which introduces new improvements to the configuration cache process. From Compile Safety to Configuration Safety: Let's Build the Koin IDE Plugin The Kotzilla team announces the upcoming release of the Koin IDE Plugin. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code Strikt Strikt is an assertion library for Kotlin intended for use with a test runner such as JUnit, Minutest or Spek. KMPDevicePreview Kotlin & Compose Multiplatform library to simulate any device from any platform, supporting Android, iOS, JVM, JS, and WebAssembly. Akkurate Akkurate is a validation library taking advantage of the expressive power of Kotlin compose_edge_to_edge_preview Library which enables you to show WindowInsets in Jetpack Compose previews News The First Developer Preview of Android 16 Android 16 Developer Preview 1 is available now to test with your apps. Introducing Restore Credentials: Effortless account restoration for Android apps Google introduces Restore Credentials, a new feature of Android‚Äôs Credential Manager API. Join us at the Women in AI Summit 2024! The Women in AI Summit is back on December 3, 2024 from 9:30am to 1:00pm PT! Join virtually for this inclusive event for anyone passionate about Artificial Intelligence (AI). Announcing the Winners of the Gemini API Developer Competition! Meet the winners of the Gemini API Developer Competition! State of Kotlin Scripting 2024 JetBrains considers the evolution of scripting in Kotlin Tools Compose Libraries Discover libraries for Jetpack Compose and Compose Multiplatform. Videos & Podcasts Animating Your World with Doris Liu Dive into Jetpack Compose Animations and learn some Compose magic! Anonymous Functions Aren't Lambdas Dave Leeds checks out what anonymous functions are and when we might want to use them. Strikt - a Powerful Assertion Library for Kotlin! Charfaoui Younes explores a powerful library for assertion in kotlin called Strikt, along with code examples and setup instructions to get started using it! How to Deserialize Inconsistent JSON Data With a Custom Kotlinx Serializer Philipp Lackner shows how you can implement a custom serializer with Kotlinx serialization to parse differing JSON structures, for example when the API has not been designed with mobile in mind. Platform Integrations in Kotlin Multiplatform with Russell Wolf Sebastian and M√°rton are joined by Russell Wolf to discuss different code sharing approaches for Kotlin Multiplatform, and how to build great multiplatform libraries. Firebase Demo Day 2024 Watch demos from Firebase Demo Day to learn how you can build and run modern, AI-powered app experiences users love with Firebase. Specials Interview with Kotlin lead designer: How far will the language diverge from Java? Kotlin lead designer Michail Zareƒçenskij spoke to DevClass about the relationship with Java and the future of the language. Android Dev Quest Android Dev Quest is an interactive puzzle game that will challenge you to think creatively and push yourself to new levels

title: Android Weekly Issue #649
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Add paywalls in one line of code Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review. StateFlow vs MutableState State management is a crucial part of Android, and Kai Cilliers takes a look at two options. The best dispatcher for a backend framework Marcin Moska≈Ça analyzes which dispatcher is the best choice for a backend applications. Mix Compose Multiplatform with native iOS UI Gabriel Souza shows how the new Compose Swift Bridge simplifies mixing Compose Multiplatform with native iOS UI. Android Interview Series 2024 ‚Äî Part 1 ‚Äî Android basics Anitaa Murthy's revamped series of Android interview questions, broken down into 8 separate articles by areas of interest. Collapsing Toolbar in Compose‚Äî PART 2 In part 2, Karishma Agrawal builds a dynamic UI with a collapsing toolbar and shows how to handle nested scrolling effectively. Enhancing AI Powered Developer Tools with Gemini API Read about Sublayer's story which showcases the transformative potential of the Gemini API. A Curious Case of Mistaken Identity: How Lambdas Break Data Class Hashing Matt McKenna tells the tale of the unstable hash that is a warning to all! A Smoother Ride: Android Emulator Stability and Performance Updates All about a Google initiative made up of several workstreams aimed at reducing crashes, speeding up startup time, closing out bugs, and setting up better ways to detect and prevent issues in the future. Not a Phase - Text with Compose and Canvas Eevis Panula looks at how to add text to Canvas and position and animate it, while also utilizing custom Google Fonts in the drawing. Skipping the invocation of intermediate composables Shreyas Patil walks through the concept of using lambdas in the composition scope and how they can be helpful in certain situations. A Developer‚Äôs Roadmap to Mastering Kotlin Multiplatform Jaewoong Eum explores the Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) ecosystem using the Kotlin Multiplatform Developer Roadmap as a guide. A Micro-optimization You Will Never Need Romain Guy shows a micro-optimization more for the fun of it than for its real impact. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Jobs Staff Android Software Engineer - Native SDKs (Remote (US)) We're seeking a Staff Android Engineer to redefine how observability data is collected and consumed. You‚Äôll lead the development of innovative SDKs and libraries to create seamless and high-performance products. Join us to revolutionize mobile observability! Libraries & Code ComposableScreens A collection of impressive designs built with Compose UI Toolkit News Introducing Native Integrations for Gravatar Mobile SDK Gravatar announced the release of native integrations for the Gravatar Mobile SDK, now available for both Android and iOS. Videos & Podcasts Fun with Function Types in Kotlin Dave Leeds looks at the different kinds of function types in Kotlin to see how we can call regular functions - and even property setters - as if they were extension functions. Accessing Camera in Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) Abdul Basit covers how we can use Camera on Android and iOS with Compose Multiplatform. Firework: Introducing Compose Hot Reload Sebastian Sellmair documents the journey of building "Compose Hot Reload" in the upcoming videos, demoing the current state and briefly introducing the project. Previewing the Unpreviewable - Placeholder Previews in Compose Philipp Lackner teaches how you can let AsyncImages, video views and other complex composables show up in your Compose preview. Kotlin Symbol Processing Made Easy: Part 2 Welcome to Part 2 of the Kotlin Symbol Processing (KSP) series and dive deeper into advanced techniques to enhance your annotation processors. Ultra HDR images | Android Build Time Tune in to hear from the team at Google Drive and the Android platform team about new capabilities in Ultra HDR. From Sprite Sheets to Stunning Animations in Jetpack Compose! KMP Library From Sprite Sheets to Stunning Animations in Jetpack Compose! KMP Library Listen To Lifecycle Events In Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to listen to lifecycle events in Jetpack Compose. Graphics layers | Jetpack Compose Tips Rebecca Franks teaches all about Graphics Layers in Compose and how you can use the APIs to composite graphics layers together to create interesting visual effects. DevFest 2024 Playlist of all the presentations from DevFest Montreal 2024 There's a new king in DI town Kaushik explores the evolution of dependency injection (DI) in Android development and chats with dependency injection expert Ralf Wondratschek for a final gut check. Kotlin Compiler - Swift Intermediate Representation (SIR) Mohit examines Swift Intermediate Representation and shares concrete examples of Swift and its SIR tree.

title: SimpleCamera
description: Simple Camera is a library that allows you to use cameras in a simplified, easy, fast and effective way. It contains CameraX as an internal library. It simplifies the camera features used by CameraX and provides ease of use with a single library. As updates come on the CameraX side, the library will try to stay up to date. Missing features will be added soon. Like video capturing.

title: EML viewer tools for different platforms
description: In the digital age, where email communication is paramount, handling various email formats becomes essential. Among these formats, EML (Email Message Format) files are widely used. EML files contain email messages and attachments, and viewing them efficiently across different platforms can be a challenge. This article explores the diverse landscape of EML viewer tools available for different platforms, aiding users in seamlessly accessing and managing their email content. The post EML viewer tools for different platforms appeared first on Universal Accessibility.
author: admgoobar

title: Viewing attachments in EML files
description: In the digital age, email communication plays a pivotal role in both personal and professional spheres. The exchange of information often involves attachments, which enhance the message‚Äôs content and functionality. Among the various file formats used in email correspondence, EML files are prominent. title: Building a sub-sampling image viewer for Compose UI
description: How do you display a 100mb image on Android without running into OutOfMemoryError? You can‚Äôt. But you can cheat. For years Android developers have used Dave Morrissey‚Äôs excellent library, subsampling-scale-image-view for displaying large bitmaps with deep zoom. It optimizes memory usage by loading lower resolution bitmaps whenever possible and avoiding loading parts of the original [‚Ä¶] The post Building a sub-sampling image viewer for Compose UI appeared first on Saket Narayan.

description: While exploring how text paragraphs are rendered in Compose UI, I nerd sniped myself into porting squiggly underlines from Sam Ruston‚Äôs Buzzkill app. Sam‚Äôs animation was implemented using TextView custom spans, but Compose UI does not offer any alternatives for them yet.
